N0OSdA3J.question: The flight crew has reported a rusty landing gear in the aircraft tech-log. After a maintenance check, the aircraft remained in service. What kind of maintenance check did the aircraft undergo?

goFtCBS5.question: The function of an accumulator in a hydraulic brake system is to

reduce pressure fluctuations of the auto-brake system.

gkftaAxn.question: What effect would an accumulator have on the Automatic Cut-Out Valve (ACOV) when installed in a hydraulic system?

increase pressure surges within the system.

zPZZu6mk.question: The purposes of an accumulator in a hydraulic system are to

damp pressure fluctuations and serve as a main pressure source for normal operation.

OuKkEiSU.question: The purpose of an accumulator in a hydraulic system is:

to bypass the pumps in the hydraulic system.

WYkzEtxF.question: The purpose of the main accumulator in a hydraulic system is:

options.text: to damp the fluid pressure variations.
to eliminate the fluid flow variations.
to bypass the pumps in the hydraulic system.

J3A6Y5hp.question: One of the functions of an accumulator in a hydraulic system is:

to store pressure.
to act as a pressure relief valve.
to store fluid.

Cool the hydraulic fluid, and act as a backup reservoir.
Dampen fluctuations in hydraulic pressure, and act as a primary reservoir.
Cool the hydraulic fluid, and act as a primary reservoir.

Qbyl52H7.question: Generally, on modern jet transport aeroplanes, if there is a complete hydraulic system failure, the landing gear can be extended by

U9aKrNyO.question: The purpose of a hydraulic fuse is to:

D9fKoj1Y.question: In a commercial transport aeroplane the landing gear normal operating system is usually

options.text: hydraulically operated.
electrically operated.
pneumatically operated.

M0aDl5Y9.question: The pilot may be prevented from retracting the landing gear whilst the aircraft is on the ground:

options.text: multiple disk brake.
single disk brake.

Ivh3JZTs.question: On a modern aeroplane, to avoid the risk of tyre burst from overheating, due for example to prolonged braking during an aborted take-off, there is

water injection triggered at a fixed temperature in order to lower tyre temperature.

the Emergency Burst function of the anti-skid system which adapts braking to the tyre temperature.

options.text: 1 and 3

RTO mode can be used for take-off and landing.
RTO has a fixed force with which the aircraft is decelerated.
experience increased wear at the shoulders.
have an increased hydroplaning speed.
be more subject to viscous aquaplaning.
experience reduced wear at the shoulders.

only if spin-up of all wheels has been detected.

if nose wheel spin-up has been detected.

options.text: The system switches to â€disarmedâ€â€or â€OFFâ€

By automatically selecting a lower deceleration level.

CsfU79p4.question: The autobrake system is disconnected after landing

at a certain low speed.
automatically.

byNRvDTD.question: Which of the following statements is correct regarding anti-skid and autobrake systems?

The autobrake system can work properly without anti-skid if the brake pedals are used additionally.
The autobrake system can work properly without anti-skid if thrust reversers are working.
The anti-skid system does not function without autobrake.

6HBSy4OM.question: An anti-retract latch blocks the landing gear lever when:

options.text: the aircraft is on the ground.
the IAS is too high for gear retraction.
the IAS is too low for gear retraction.
the gear is in unsuitable configuration for extension.

BGjfXdBy.question: Overcentre mechanisms in landing gear systems are used to:

lock the landing gear in the up position.
ensure the nose wheel is centred prior to retraction.
ensure that the nose wheel does not exceed the maximum deflection.

5W3sgkQu.question: An aircraft is correctly loaded, but its nosewheel extension is two inches less than normal. What is the most likely cause?

options.text: Too little nitrogen in the oleo strut.
Too much nitrogen in the oleo strut.
Too much oil in the oleo strut.
A downdraught at the tail.

Bk87eOTk.question: What is the best technique to brake during taxi

Using Steel brakes and heavy applicaiton

Using carbon brakes and small applications

1 is correct, 2 is incorrect.
1 is incorrect, 2 is incorrect.
1 is incorrect, 2 is correct.

rKCkaIAi.question: The failure of an anti-skid system...

increase the minimum braking distance on a slippery runway only.
does not increase the braking distance during a rejected take-off, provided the pilot applies maximum braking.
increases the minimum braking distance on a dry runway only.

SdjjaJBg.question: How is the landing gear usually locked in the down position after an emergency extension?

options.text: A lower over-centre lock.
A hook lock.

wheel hubs.
fire warning systems.
cabin windows.
cargo compartments.

4oyGejcK.question: Select the correct statement regarding an auto-brake system during a rejected take-off.

GNvHAFCQ.question: A pilot should check the wheels and tyres during their pre-flight check, which statement is correct?

options.text: If tread separation is left undetected, the tyre could burst during take-off or landing.
Tread separation is easy to detect.
The tyre treads are not an important item to be checked during the pre-flight inspection.
Tread inspection is the responsibility of the maintenance personnel before the first flight of the day.

YjTi9nnJ.question: Which of these statements about an auto-brake system is correct?

options.text: When using manual braking during taxiing, the auto-brake system remains armed
When a low auto-brake setting is used during landing use of reverse will not influence the brake temperature
When the auto-brake system is inoperative, in general take-off is not allowed, because maximum manual braking does not achieve the same deceleration as the auto-brake system in the RTO mode
On most aeroplanes the auto-brake system provides the capability to select a fixed landing distance

WVYbm5mo.question: The auto-brake system stops operating during landing ...

options.text: by the pilot pressing the brake pedals.
by the pilot selecting idle reverse thrust.
when the pilot does not lower the nose wheel to the ground.
by the pilot extending ground spoilers.

Wk65KyhD.question: An aural alert is generated by a landing gear extension system when:

options.text: attempting to perform a landing with the gear retracted.
flying too fast with the gear extended.
not retracting gear after take-off.
attempting to retract gear while on the ground (weight on wheels).

4qsNf3RI.question: When using the pressurized nitrogen bottle system for emergency landing gear extension:

options.text: The emergency system is activated manually by pulling a handle in the cockpit, allowing a one-shot extension.
The emergency system is activated manually by pulling a handle in the cockpit, allowing the system to be used several times.
The emergency system is automatically activated upon failure of the main system, allowing a one-shot extension of the landing gear.
The emergency system is automatically activated upon failure of the main system and can be used several times.

GHLu7PcO.question: If a take-off is rejected, what happens after the RTO braking action is completed?

options.text: The brakes block the wheel rims.
The brake application will be reduced.
The hydraulic pressure is reduced to zero.
The brake pressure is released.

oD7jH2Af.question: Over center mechanisms in landing gear systems are generally used to

options.text: Lock the landing gear in place

Defalates the tyres automatically if the temperature rises too high

At least one wheel is in the travelling or unlocked
condition.

The landing gear has been selected down using the
emergency extension system.
All wheels are down and locked.
All wheels are up and locked.

Jgs0Shky.question: What is true about the autobrake system during landing?

It is disconnected automatically if thrust reversers are deployed.
It is possible to dial in a fixed stopping distance.
If used at low settings, use of reverser will not have any effect.

repaired once.

oMT2t6j4.question: During taxiing before take-off the normal auto-brake system selection before take-off is made. Immediately afterwards, but still before commencement of the take-off, heavy braking is applied. This causes the auto-brake system:

to generate the selected deceleration.
to remain armed. In this mode it will be impossible to apply normal braking below a certain low speed. (e.g. 15 kt)
to switch to the mode â€œDISARMâ€.

PpzGgj3i.question: How does the emergency landing gear extension usually occur in a modern jet transport aircraft?

Gravity extension with doors closed by a separate hydraulic actuator.

DW1l5zwV.question: A main landing gear is said to be "locked down" when:

the corresponding indicator lamp is amber.

4pSj1X9O.question: Which of the following statements about an autobrake is correct?

options.text: An autobrake gives a constant deceleration on dry runway.
An autobrake will always stop the airplane within the shortest distance possible.
An autobrake can be used if antiskid is inoperative.
With an unserviceable autobrake, the take-off is "normally" not allowed, because manual braking will take more distance to stop in case of a RTO.

XEMCfuL6.question: What are the basic functionalities of a smoke hood?

options.text: To provide breathable gas and protect the user`s eyes, nose, and mouth from toxic fumes and smoke.
To protect the user from flames and smoke irritating the eyes by providing goggles that are integrated in the smoke hood.
To protect the entire body of the user against toxic fumes, smoke, and heat.
For sealing a smoke source by tightly covering it such that the smoke stops through oxygen starvation and cooling the smoke source.
allows the aircraft to be contacted on VHF and HF frequencies that are not being monitored by the flight crew.
allows two way VHF data transmission between ATC and aircraft.
allows satellite communication.
allows two way data transmission between operator and aircraft.
will disconnect by pressing the pedals.
will disconnect automatically by turning on the ground (e.g. leaving the runway).
will disconnect automatically below a certain speed.
can only be disconnected by the pilot if the switch is set to OFF position.
When the weight on wheels switch is activated.
Only if reverse thrust is selected.
Manually only.
If spin-up of all wheels has been detected.

xP6W8bYR.question: The automatic ground spoiler extension system is normally activated during landing by:

options.text: main wheel spin up.
brake pressure application.
ground spoiler handle.
idle thrust selection.

FuUA1Jio.question: Extension of the wing spoilers is often limited to a maximum airspeed. What is the reason for this?

options.text: To prevent structural damage to the spoilers at excessive dynamic pressures.
To prevent roll control problems at high speed.
To prevent longitudinal instability at high speed.
To ensure maximum fuel efficiency by braking at the highest possible speed.

Q9P9OpRm.question: The primary element necessary for automatic ground spoiler deployment during landing is...

options.text: spinning-up of the main wheel.
selecting reverse thrust.
applying brake pressure.
operating the ground spoiler control handle.

g75UkNmq.question: An aeroplane extends its flaps asymmetrically. The aircraft will roll...

options.text: towards the side with fewer flaps and have a yawing moment to the opposite side.
towards the side with more flaps and have a yawing moment to the opposite side.
towards the side with more flaps and have a yawing moment to the same side.
towards the side with fewer flaps and have a yawing moment to the same side.

IAR6Uo9e.question: For most large aeroplanes, spoilers are..

upper wing surface devices and their deflection is always asymmetrical.
lower wing surface devices and their deflection can be either symmetrical or asymmetrical.
lower wing surface devices and their deflection is always asymmetrical.

C3vyo4A5.question: During a normal pressurized climb after take-off:

absolute cabin pressure increases to compensate for the fall in pressure outside the aeroplane.
the pressurization system is inoperative until an altitude of 10 000 ft is reached.
the cabin differential pressure is maintained constant.

pDfo6Gvs.question: When the hydraulic system supplying the brakes in normal operation is inoperative, the brakes can still be operated..  which one below is correct?

options.text: using a standby hydraulic system.
manually.
using a pneumatic standby system.
using their normal brake accumulator.

V7y1eRU9.question: With regard to a jet aeroplane, specific range is the:

fuel flow per unit of thrust.

IhEt159I.question: The shear neck is a device fitted to prevent...
